    • Method Detail

      • entryaction

        public void entryaction(int nodeNr,
                        int level)
                 throws IOException
        On the entry action, the current edge string is pushed on the edges' stack. This ensures, that on the exit action the full path up to the (then) current node will be present on the stack. NOTE: This assumes depth-first traversal of the tree in the tree walker.
        Specified by:
        entryaction in interface ITreeWalkerListener
        Parameters:
        nodeNr - the node whose edge is to be pushed on the stack.
        level - (irrelevant here, required by interface)
        Throws:
        IOException - if the implementation throws one.

      • exitaction

        public void exitaction(int nodeNr,
                       int level)
                throws IOException
        On the exit action the edges' stack is assumed to contain all edges up to the current node in the tree. If the current node is a terminal node and the path up to this point is a full input text (not a suffix) the edges of the path are written to output separate by this.class.SEPARATOR. NOTE: This assumes depth-first traversal of the tree in the tree walker.
        Specified by:
        exitaction in interface ITreeWalkerListener
        Parameters:
        nodeNr - the node whose edges are to be printed.
        level - (irrelevant here, required by interface)
        Throws:
        IOException - if the implementation throws one.

      • hasCompleted

        public boolean hasCompleted()
        Allows to check if processing of the tree has finished. (Simply checks if each edge that was pushed to the stack was popped as well.)
        Returns:
        true or false
